Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable hotel in a great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Hmbtitl
Reviews.Content: We rented the suite for six nights and were so pleased with the great room, friendly/funny/ultra-helpful staff, and the fantastic location. Also, the optional breakfast is delicious and beautifully traditional French.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location and freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: MVP_10
Reviews.Content: We had not stayed on the Left Bank for over 40 years so based on TA reviews we selected the Hotel mainly because reviewers liked its quiet, walking distance location to so many sights, monuments, and museums, and staff. We were a bit cautious, so we booked a suite for about 100E more and were not disappointed. While the amennities are limited the free wireless was wonderful, and the morning breakfast delicious and served to room until noon. There is some construction going on next door which starts up around 9am weekdays, but the windows seal out the noise and were on 2nd floor. Henri at reception organized transport to CDG and had many suggestions. We often visit Paris and expecially loved being able to have great English speakers at reception and in management. We found this most valuable. The area speaks for itself. Louvre, Norte Dame, Quai d'Orsay, etc. all a simple walk and the dining within 2 blocks offering evertying from Michelin 2 star to Creperie take-outs. Even though a half block away the pedestrian traffic seems to never stop, once we headed down the street and back to the hotel peace and quiet reign. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but....”
Reviews.Author: Tafi1971
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the position perfect as walk distance to almost everything. The receptionist are very supporting and kind. The hotel, room ans breakfast space are very tiny but cosy. It is an old building so there is some understang on this. What a customer cannot understand is how you pay quite a lot the room rate ( ca. 250/ night for an executive without breakfasr) and the cleaning lady hasn't had found the time to clean you room between 10.00 and 14.30. So were we told. Than we accomodate to go out again around 15.30 even if we were tired and with a small child, in order to let the room to be done, but the lady already left! Ok this is not a drama, anyone can handle to stay in the room not redone, but at least the customer has to be provided with some special treatment, eventually discount or breakfast offered. These are little things that make forget the customer the inconvenient. If nothing is proposed, the customer feel only pulled by the legs...and I do nor like this!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but I won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Sky057
Reviews.Content: This is an honest and mixed review. Very friendly hotel, the people speak English well and are really very happy to help with advice, a taxi, ideas on itinerary, dining reservations and shopping.....anything.  The staff are just as friendly as many travelers on these TA reviews claim.  I had a suite, wonderful windows, two I could open wide up and let fresh air into. All their rooms have windows that open up beautifully, just like the windows in old French movies. The rooms are very clean and fresh. The TVs are modern flat-screens (I found CNN which is in Emglish). There was no dvd player.  Toiletries are provided, a minibar with the basics, and a safe.   The furniture is clean and beautiful.   Appoline at the front desk is an absolute delight, as helpful as she is beautiful, with perfect English. Lena is also very lovely and helpful, and it was so very nice to have met her.  She even made me a coffee late one night. Bathrooms are modern -  my suite had a long spa bath that could fit two in but is ideally for one.  There is a double wardrobe with hangers provided in the suite lounge area and a shelf. There was also a good chest of draws in the bedroom. The back of door to the suite has two lovely hooks to hang jackets on which was very handy. My son had a single room and it was clean and good and fresh with a single wardrobe and a very modern small bathroom, and a lovely window too. If two people sleep in the suite, the person sleeping near the wall would need to bend under/around the TV to get out to go the toilet. In other words, you can walk around easily to get in at one side of the bed but not the other. This is not a problem for people with good mobility. Unfortunately during my stay the building next door was being renovated and I woke to the sound of drilling, electric saws and hammering. This was a disappointment as most of you can imagine, but certainly not the hotel's fault. These things happen. My suite did not have mobile phone reception which was a huge disappointment for me, due to the time difference with my husband in Australia. Our preferred mode of communication together while I was in Paris was lots of text messages and calls.  We just made the best of it. If mobile reception is important to you, make sure you have a room that does not face the interior courtyard. The free wifi worked perfectly. Attention to finer details is not consistent at this hotel, but this may not be a concern to you. For example, I had no information in my room on how to connect to the Internet, nothing on how/when laundry was collected, or on how to use the phone to call reception. But I just had to ask and I was very nicely told all I needed to know. I personally just prefer to have information available to me in my room and not to have to ask.  The maid cleaned very well but left no laundry bag in my room, neither in my son's room. The first day she left one clean bath towel instead of two.  She (there were two different maids during my stay) left no spare toilet roll on the second and neither on the third or fourth day. If I ran a hotel I'd like my guests not to have to worry (and hope) that they won't run out of toilet paper at an inconvenient time. Again, I only had to ask for a second roll and I got one. I ran out of tissues but just used toilet paper. So no big deal but for the price of my suite, I did not expect to experience these small issues. The hotel is very well located, central to everything....2 minutes from the metro, 5 minutes to the Notre Dame, 1 minute to the Siene, 1 minute to delicious  crepes - just go to endnof the street moving away from the river, go left at the Irish pub and after 50 metres on the left you come to a street corner with a friendly guy who makes nice crepes.....ask them to put only a little nutella on otherwise they load it on, 5 minutes to the Shakespeare English Bookshop, 10 minutes walk to Ludaree, & Paul's Bakery, 3 minutes to St Germaine des Pres Blvd and probably just a 10 minute walk to the Louve, oh and just 4 minutes to the post office which is very helpful and they are friendly providing you with a box if you need to send things home due to shopping too much :).  The main not-so-good was that my room door was opened with a key without a knock on the door, twice. Once by the owner with a maintenance man and once by a older maid the next day. At this hotel you have to hand in your key when you leave, so the hotel staff know very well when you are in and when you are out .....IF they take the time to check. The owner also opened my sons room door while he was sick and had just fallen asleep.  Same thing happened with a older maid the next day to both of us. My son and I were in different rooms on different floors. For this reason, I feel it was not an accident, it was simply not bothering (or caring) to check with reception about who was in and who was out. For me personally this was an invasion of privacy that I really didn't like and for that reason alone I persoanlly would not stay again. It would be a good idea for the hotel to implement a  'Do Not Disturb' sign available to guests. The bed was not very comfortable and that was the second deal breaker for me. The covers are wonderful, but the mattress was not comfortable.     If you like home style service, really friendly personal service, a clean and unique hotel with much character in a great location, and if the little things I mentioned are not deal breakers for you,  then you will probably enjoy staying in this hotel. It certainly does have a personal family feel about it and it's very clean and unique.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Geoff D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Vieux Paris for 4 nights and met friends who were also staying.Wonderful location to visit the left bank attractions and very close to St Michel metro stop. Nice presentation of an an ancient building and helpful staff (we arrived well after midnight). Plenty of restuarants and bars nearby including some famous ones such as Tour D'argent, Laperouse and le Procope (if you want to eat where the French Revolution was hatched by Robespierre and Co). Musee D'Orsay is a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Such an amazing hotel with history”
Reviews.Author: BohdanAbrat
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Vieux Paris is so charming and magical. The staff are very very helpful - just ask and they will accomodate to the best of their means. This 15th Century hotel has what modern 5 star hotels don't - a feel of familiarity, comfort and style. The beat generation poets used this site as their base and home in days gone by, in the coolest shiek area in Paris. You can still feel the cool vibe. Don't expect perfect 5 star amenities in a building that was erected in 1480. Everything here is way better than 5 star - and charming to boot. Room was super comfy, loved the fabric wall papers, the exposed beams, and the size of the room. Breakfast is a must - although french breakfasts are not over the top with eggs and meats, this will start you up for a great day of seeing the parisian sites, or meandering through st germain or the latin quarter taking it all in. We found that any breakfasts outside the hotel were of inferior quality and at least the same price or more. And of course, the best thing about breakfast is having a good chat to Madame Odillard who loves her hotel, and has the best stories and insights into the world. You can't pay for that at an outside cafe; and certainly not for only 13 euro! Also - if you hang downstairs inthe lobby you'll be sure to see some very interesting people - and some very famous guests. You can't beat the great vibe of people and culture. Stay here if you cool, friendly, artistic... if you just just want a mod-con hotel try an american hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice staff and clean room”
Reviews.Author: MireilleNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights. Although the room was very small, the staff was very nice. They all speak English, which is helpful. The breakfast is great, the bread and pastries are fresh, coffee delicious and they also give you yogurt and fruit salad. There is a good selection of Paris guide available, along with some International newspaper. The location is great too. Frankly I would recommend it to everyone. The elevator IS SMALL :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family run”
Reviews.Author: bobtrav
Reviews.Content: Many people make examples of individuals at each hotel. We have stayed 10 times in Paris hotels over the last 5 years. This is tops Apollonia who mans the desk most days was the reason I booked this over many in the area all mentioned in this blog. My wife and I were richly rewarded. She put us on two of the top pastry shops in Paris and gave us some eating suggestions. The other man at the desk was as good. This is not one of those corporate feel hotels like the Dauphine St Germaine has become we are over that. We also stayed at a modest hotel on Andre des arts called the Commerce hotel.. Not for everyone but we loved it. No lift so be ready to tote bags. The Relais is on a side street very quiet for Paris. You will have the time of your life and they are very knowlegeable in anything you need with great advice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: FranceDenver
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here and really enjoyed it. Although small, the room was very comfortable and charmingly decorated. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the location was ideal. It's right on a major metro line - St. Michel-Notre Dame - which made getting around extremely easy. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Craig S
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed my stay. Great location for getting about the city. Metro a very short walk away (and on the direct line to Gard du Nord and Gare du l'Est). Friendly and helpful staff. And the smallest lift I've seen 0 but don't let that put you off. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Jurgen W
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 4th visit… mixed business with wedding anniversary… this is THE place to stay in Paris.... in the heart of the Latin Quarter… either for business, family vacation or romantic rendezvous with wife... Staff super helpful and friendly… rooms to suit your taste and budget, all extremely comfortable and Spotlessly CLEAN!!! Near St. Michel Metro and RER, taxi stand, steps from Notre Dame, plenty of dining options from world famous Allard… to a gyro stand… Year after year a favorite.,

Reviews.Title: “first stay, but not the last......”
Reviews.Author: geevee99
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, relaxed and fantastically well positioned. eight of us stayed for a long weekend, and unlike mblock9876's review found Remy very polite and helpful throughout, as were his colleagues. I have difficulty imagining him responding other than positively. Our daughter is handicapped and uses a wheelchair - this hotel, like most of similar age and construction is simply not equipped to handle that challenge. Would we stay here again? Certainly!

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: FEMNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on and off since 1981, before it was renovated. Mmm. Odillard and now her daughter-in-law always make you feel welcome. The service is wonderful, the ambieance truly Parisienne, the location fantastique. You are in walking distance from everything - Notre Dame, the Marais, the Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens, yet you are on a quiet street. I have stayed here no fewer than 10 times, and though I occasionally have stayed elsewhere, you are always made to feel at home here. I hope to visit in April.

Reviews.Title: “This review is based only on my expieriance with the front desk”
Reviews.Author: mblock9876
Reviews.Content: I have been looking forward to visiting this hotel for a few months. My husband and I are renewing our marriage vows and need a quant boutiqu hotel to hold our guests as well as ourselves. My mother accompanied me to the hotel. She is disabled in a wheel chair. We did not have a reservation for the hotel but merely wondered if we could see a room or a picture so I could have an idea of what this hotel provides since I have not stayed here before. Remy was the man on duty behind the desk. My French was a little bit broken since I am from the US and I could tell that this annoyed him. I told him that we were looking to book the hotel for several rooms in April. Remy said that all the rooms were booked which is understandable. And of course we wouldn't want to disturb anyone. So, since I had my mother with me in a wheel chair and we couldn't see any rooms I asked him where the best place was to pick up a taxi to take us out to dinner. He then got very upset. Said that we should not have made up a story to see the hotel and wasted his time. My mother left the lobby in tears. He still called the taxi. On the way out I told him that we had come all the way from Chicago to see this hotel. I have a friend who stayed here and had a very positive expieriance. I told Remy that he upset my Mother who is a senior citizen . He yelled at me said that I was obnoixious I am not proud of this but I said he was acting like a cochon and left immediatly. In my entire life I have never called anyone that. Nor have I been treated so rudely by a staff membor of a hotel. I sincerly hope the owner of this beautiful looking hotel sees this review. My mother was devastated since it was her idea to renew my vows with my husband in Paris. Even though this occured on the last day of our visit to Paris Im glad ti happened so I avoid making the mistake of booking this hotel in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PARIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Harriet B
Reviews.Content: Relais Hotel du Vieux Paris was a brilliant find. Perfect location a half block from the Seine on the Left Bank in the 6th; beautiful accommodations; lovely proprietor; friendly, attentive, well-informed reception staff; fabulous breakfasts; close to everything. Walk to D'Orsay, Louvre, Pompidou museums, Notre Dame, Saint Chapelle, Boulevard Saint Germain, Shakespeare & Co., all major sights and stores, river cruises. Small, intimate, yet private with full booking services for restaurants and tours. We loved our ten days at Vieux Paris and plan to return in future. Absolutely fabulous hotel! Harriet B.

Reviews.Title: “RELAIS HOTEL DU VIEUX PARIS - perfect location, wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Leanna J
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay at the RELAIS HOTEL DU VIEUX PARIS on the Left Bank (6th arr) in Paris. The hotel is charming, small enough to be attentive and responsive to every request, but large enough to afford discretion and separation of guests, and is perfectly located a half block from the Seine River, close to Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, the Louvre, Tuilleries, the St. Germain shopping area, the RER and metro, and many many good restaurants. The hotel is also far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the Latin Quarter and the busy intersections. It is quiet and elegant. The hotel itself is decorated with rich fabrics, half-timbered beams and luxury appointments. The suites are enough room, even by American standards! Remy (at the desk) is so helpful, and his advice and humor appreciated. Seeing his face, and Henri's and Pauline's, each time we set out for the day, or came home for the evening, was a comforting sight. We will likely always stay at this hotel, as the service, location and memories are always perfect.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: richard m
Reviews.Content: great location. comfortable quarters, new bathrooms, good lighting outstanding front desk/concierge help

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: cyrille M
Reviews.Content: could not have picked a better place. right in the heart of Paris and walking distance to many landmarks. very nice hotel to stay with a family atmosphere and friendly staff. loved the serenity inside compared with the hustle and bustle outside. would stay again when next in Paris. Contrary to some comments Paris restaurants are not expensive compared to New York and Sydney and some as the Papilles on Rue Gay Lussac offer outstanding value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, recommend it for you all”
Reviews.Author: Åsa
Reviews.Content: Funny wall decorations. Friendly staff, a family hotel Nice bed, totally quiet room with thick walls. Close to subway and trains Close to all restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and very comfortable with very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: petescroggs
Reviews.Content: Eating out in Paris is very expensive and all the rester aunts seem to offer the same menu. Across the Rue Saint Michelle from the hotel are loads of places offering set menus from 10 euros worth a look when you need a quick cheaper meal.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, ideally-located hotel with wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: EnjoymentOfLife
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel twice -- once in 2000 with our 2 then teenagers and, most recently, in 2011 as a carefree couple. We only stayed one night in 2011 before flying home the next day and feared that the hotel would not be the same as our memory from 11 years earlier. We were not disappointed. The rooms are small, but if what you are looking for is a grand American style or touristy hotel, this is not it. if on the other hand you want a clean, well appointed, quaint hotel with superb personal attention, this hotel fits the bill. The staff both times were amazingly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel in a Perfect Location with Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Leo S
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed here in August 2011 and we could not have asked for a better place to stay whilst in Paris! It was so perfectly located in the Latin Quarter, and close to the bus system. The staff were always sooooooo friendly!! They were always up for a chat and to assist in our daily plans. We also were blown away by the history of this place! THE BEAT HOTEL!!! Madame Odillard was amazing to speak too also and always offered us a kind smile with her assistance. We will be back! =)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ishapupper
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my two kids (two rooms) and it was extremely expensive. The location is fabulous but the rooms are small. The air-conditioning stopped working the first and second day we were there - but started working again from the 3rd to 8th day. The one tiny little elevator stopped working the 3rd day we were there - which was a huge problem given we were on the 4th and 5th floor - but started working again on the 4th day. The staff speak English and were pleasant - except when we were trying to check in on the first day. We were tired and very hot but our rooms weren't ready for several hours after they were supposed to be. Every time I inquired, they looked at me like I was terribly rude to even ask what was taking so long. For $7,000 US for 8 nights (no food - just the two rooms) , it was not a good experience and I would never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel, Customer Service at its Best”
Reviews.Author: Sadie2240
Reviews.Content: Adorable hotel and a block from the Siene River and just a 5 minute walk to the Notre Dame. Mr. Remi at the Front Desk was instrumental in securing our team's reservations and exceptionally helpful in assisting with early morning taxi reservations, city directions, and subway directions. I had a beautiful blue and white toile covered room. It was small, but the perfect size for just me. I left my Moulin Rouge poster in the room and contacted Remi upon my return to the United States. He was helpful in sending the poster back to me promptly...and without hesitation. That is CUSTOMER SERVICE. I hope to be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice individual Hotel in Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: steve.b67
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was the end point en route for our Cycle Ride from London to Paris. I emailed the hotel in advance along with others in the area to enquire about safe storage for our bikes. They were the only ones to bother to reply, offering storage in their office. So we booked and got a great advance rate for a very comfortable and large twin room. The Hotel is on a very quite side street in the heart of the Latin Quarter, 2 mins from loads of shops, bars, restaurants and the sights of Notre Dame etc. We really liked having a high quality, family run, small hotel in the heart of the city. Such a refreshing change from the identikit chains. Remy will you a warm multi lingual welcome. Top breakfasts too, the strongest coffee and the freshest juice of the trip. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Tired Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bisou4U
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about staying in Paris at this hotel. The location was perfect. You could walk just about everywhere from here and there were lots of restaurants and activities nearby. We paid almost three hundred dollars a night; breakfast was an additional $18 per person. We had the superior room with the red and white toile fabric. The room was small (OK, it's Paris; most rooms are small). However, the bedspread was faded and had tattered holes in it. I assume they dared not change it because then it wouldn't match the fabric walls. But come on, when I pay this much per night I expect clean looking linens. My suggestion, go with the white duvet covers that all the boutique hotels use now. It will still match the walls and won't be a gross out. The carpeting was also tired looking and needs to be changed. The towels were large but not white and fluffy. The very small bathroom was clean and updated, but the toilet paper holder was broken and the roll would fly off each time you pulled on it. There was also some dirty grout in the shower. Breakfast was the ubiquitous croissant, coffee and yogurt served in a charming room. The price was a little steep for what we got. Ordinarily, I wouldn't complain; but, this was an expensive hotel, and I expected better. Overall, the room was a disappointment and I will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant helpful staff, large room for a boutique style Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: FavouriteParis
Reviews.Content: We have such happy memories of our latest holiday break in Paris and only positive comments to make about this very conveniently located, comfortable, elegantly furnished, super clean Paris hotel just steps from the left bank but in a quiet bar-free street, and all of the staff we met during our week long stay were pleasant, helpful and businesslike, good ambassadors for their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff A
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a centrally-located hotel on a quiet street for a reasonable rate, for our week in Paris, and this place was almost perfect. It's a short walk to Notre Dame and several other attractions, as well as Ile St Louis, with great shops and Berthillon ice cream, and the main shopping areas of Paris are nearby as well. Excellent cafes and restaurants are nearby, as are the Metro stops and the Shakespeare Book Shop. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, but the staff were all very friendly and helpful, especially Apolline! The room was clean and comfortable, and just big enough, and our room on the top floor has two skylights that open for fresh air. The bathroom was a bit small, but manageable, but that wasn't a big concern for us since we spent almost all of our time seeing the wonderful sights of Paris and Versailles.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: betsy04
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a 3 star hotel, but decided to upgrade thinking that the room and amenities would be nicer at this hotel - supposedly a 4 star. Well, there was no way this should have been a 4 star. The room (a junior suite) was tiny - didn't even have a dresser. The blankets were pilled, the bathtub glass door would not stay closed - bathroom fixtures were old and the (very loud) garabage trucks came promptly at 6:30 every morning to wake us up. The only thing I can recommend is that the front desk staff were all very nice and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: mossboston
Reviews.Content: This little, historic hotel at the edge of the Latin Quarter is a wonder of convenience. On a tiny, quiet street - perfect for sleeping- it is within steps of the Seine, St. Michel Metro/RER station, and Ile de la Cite. Right off of Rue Saint Andres des Arts, it is a very short work to dozens of cafes, restaurants, and small shops, all open until late to accommodate the many young people who visit the area in the evenings. From there one can quickly walk to the Seine, the Louvre, Notre Dame, and Vedettes du Pont Neuf ( a very worthwhile boat ride on the Seine). The staff is friendly and helpful. We did not avail ourselves of the breakfast as other options were so readily available. The elevator is big enough for two people (if not too large) OR several bags, but the front desk staff assisted us in getting up to our first floor room upon arrival. The room itself was pretty small but well equipped with large bed, TV (did not see an English channel), free WIFI, small fridge (all items in it were for purchase). The bathroom was also small, but also well equipped and had a great shower and big towels and even robes and slippers. There was a cell phone that we did not use, so I do not know the arrangements on that. Maps, current newspapers and guide books are available in the lobby. If you are looking for great location, a quiet night's sleep, and good value, this hotel is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel with a beatnik history”
Reviews.Author: tom_oz11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Saint Michael District with plenty of bars and restaurants at the door step. Rooms are small as expected in Europe and any historical buildings but they are fine. The front desk staff are very friendly are ready to help with any questions or problems.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Kerryjane08
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to this historic hotel on the Seine's left bank, this time traveling with three teenage girls. We had two rooms on the fourth floor and all of us were completely charmed by this hotel! The girls loved shopping on their own in the many fabulous shops in the St. Germaine area and having an easy walk to the cathedral of Notre Dame. The staff was very helpful and friendly and everyone speaks English. The hotel is very old and has many charming details - I particularly love the old beam ceilings - with lots of modern amenities, including wifi. I can't imagine staying anywhere else when I go to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Avoid the Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: FrankCritic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, great proximity to both St Michel Metro station and the Latin Quarter – surrounded by great restaurants, reasonably priced. There’s a real Parisian atmosphere – so would recommend. The hotel itself is nice, the staff were friendly and helpful – and it’s positioned just off the main area, so quiet enough for those looking for peace (unless your room is next to the lift which is a bit noisy). Free Wifi was particularly useful for late night/early morning research etc. The only downside was upon departure being charged just shy of £80 for the breakfast (3 days 2 people) – which had it been great we would have been fine with, however here it’s just a couple of croissants, half a French bread, a yogurt and a very small and relatively poor fruit salad (obviously including tea and coffee). In hindsight we should have just asked how much it was first, but after the first morning I was convinced this could have only been complimentary! We’d be happy to recommend this place, however my only suggestion would be to avoid the breakfast as you’d get much better (quality and price) just around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “A great romantic place”
Reviews.Author: zarah2011
Reviews.Content: Finding a good hotel is not easy ! But this one is different . First of all, the staff : always friendly and ready to help ! The location of this small boutique hotel is unique : right in the center of ther Latin Quarter and close to the major Parisian spots such as Notre Dame & Musee d'Orsay ( do not miss it , - the front desk also sells tickets to skip the long lines ! ). We had a wonderfull stay in this hotel : we loved our room ( on the fourth floor, N° 46 , I think ? which had an amazing decoration - traditional country French I would say . This was an experience, so exotic, so romantic, so French !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: Polly60878
Reviews.Content: We loved this charming little hotel. The best thing about our stay at The Vieux Paris was taking the continental breakfast in our room while planning our day using the free wifii which is now rare in hotels. The room was really cozy with the wall fabrics and beams. We stayed a week so we had time to talk to the owner and listen to her tell us about the " Beat Hotel " !! My husband is in the whole beat generation thing so he chose this hotel when he saw it on internet and it was really a wonderful surprise. What was amazing is that you feel like home when you pass the door, but you are actually in Paris with all the nice things to visit so close !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best one”
Reviews.Author: HelmutSpeer
Reviews.Content: Hidden gem. Right in the latin quarter, in small hidden street, so it’s very quiet. It is close to the Seine and Rue Saint-Andre des Arts, which is very popular among young people, especially due to many small bars, caffe, etc.. The stuff is very friendly and nice. There is small elevator which is good because there are five floors. Rooms are  small, as all rooms in Paris:-) but very romantic and cosy. The furnitures are nice and stylish. And the bathroom is small, but clean. I I highly recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, convenient and colourful.”
Reviews.Author: Noshtalgia
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel in the heart of the vibrant Latin quarter. We were greeted by friendly, helpful staff and the room was old Parisian with a modern bathroom. We were 20 metres away from the Seine, ample eateries and shops. We were walking distance from the Louvre, Musee du Orsay, Notre Dame, Champs Elysee and we also managed the Eiffel Tower. At was a magic, romantic four nights with very accommodating hosts who were very ready to suggest activities and eateries. I would not hesitate recommending this hotel - it is worth the little extra for the location but the hotel ambiance made it even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home In Paris”
Reviews.Author: StillTheOldie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here six times, and consider it one of the most charming finds in Paris. yes, you pay for suite amenities in the always expensive 6th arrondisement, and the living space is, well, bijou, but it is nicely luxurious and full of character. And it's quiet! We love the service, and we love the 'hood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Krum29
Reviews.Content: To help give prospective to who I am and what type of review/trip this is, my husband and I went on a 2 week trip to Europe traveling during the last two weeks in Oct 2010. We are 29 year-old working professionals from Atlanta. We like high quality nice things for a good price. We are not overly outdoorsy, but active. We used this trip to get out of our comfort zone. We took trains in between the Italian cities and carried backpacks. It was a wonderful adventure and experience. We visited Paris, Venice, Florence, Chianti Region, Pisa, Lucca, Cinque Terre, Siena, and Rome. We stayed overnight at hotels or B&B’s in Paris, Venice, Florence, Cinque Terre, Siena, Rome. We used the Rick Steve’s guide book series to plan our trip and tried to keep to the suggested trip budget therefore we controlled our cost by staying in affordable accommodations in some cities, but we did splurge in a couple. We also used tripadvior for selecting many of our accommodations. Where we stayed and what we paid: Paris - Relais Hotel Vieux Paris – 206 Euro a night on a special internet deal Venice – 3C B&B – 170 Euro a night w/breakfast Florence - Le Stanze dei Medici B&B– 70 Euro a night w/breakfast Cinque Terre - Manuel's Guesthouse – 80 Euro a night Siena - Pensione Palazzo Ravizza– 170 Euro a night w/breakfast Rome - Roman Residence– 130 Euro a night w/ breakfast & open mini bar & bottle of wine General observations: • It seems everywhere had a little more noise than I’m used to, but there are many factors for that. First, I am not used to living in a city and we wanted to be close to all the sights and second most of the flooring at the places we stayed had tile or wood therefore sound carried more than if there was carpet. I would not let that deter you for any of these places. • At hotels you get full service, people to ask questions to all the time because there is someone at the front desk 24/7, but at many B&B’s there is only someone there for a limited time so you must get your questions and dinner reservations in when you check in or first thing in the morning if you would like assistance. • I’m bias because I spent many hours researching where to stay for our trip, but ultimately felt each place was wonderful in its own way and the most bang-for-the-buck. Paris - Relais Hotel Vieux Paris Location: Wonderful! I would stay there again in a heartbeat! The hotel is nestled on a quiet little street in between all the action of the Latin quarter and St. Germain district. It’s on the left bank extremely close to Notre Dame (night right across, but almost). The hotel is in the old district so there are a lot of cute small streets with shops. I think this hotel and location is why Paris was my favorite city we visited! Room: We were upgraded to the red suite which had a sitting room in it. We had tons of room in our bedroom and in our sitting room. We also had a tub/shower combo in the bathroom which was a huge plus. All the walls were covered in fabric, so this was probably our quietist place for sleep. Service: Was wonderful, everyone at the hotel was extremely helpful! They suggested a wonderful restaurant for us to have a romantic dinner at called “Christie”. The place was modern and classy and fit our personalities perfectly and the food was amazing. Food: We can’t comment on the food b/c we took the advice of previous reviews and didn’t take part in the hotel breakfast Please look at the other places we stayed for my reviews on them. I know this review is extremely long, but I hope you find it helpful. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: heartguy83
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in the lively Latin Quarter and began to search for hotels for a 6 night stay. They bill themselves as a 4 star facility but it is far from it. It does not have a plaque out front from from the French ministry of tourism as most hotels in Paris. Inside we had what they billed as a "superior" room room. The room had no windows. There were 2 skylights above the bed (2 singles pushed together) that opened. When it rained we couldn't use these. The air conditioner was spotty and didn't cool when it worked. There was a sitting area up a small staircase that is unusable. There were no 4 star amenities-plastic cups, one hand towel for 2 people, etc. The rooms are tiny-smaller even for European standards. No closet-one small wardrobe that is inadequate. The staff were pleasant. Despite saying the had concierge service when I asked them to change a trip we had planned to Giverny the front desk person simply put me through to the agency rather than take care of it as I had requested. They had made the original reservation. I would say this is not as billed and while adequate it is not a 4 star hotel and would not recommend it for those that want a 4 star facility. Unfortunately they kept the 4 star price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: em7303
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a few days in Paris, and were recommended this hotel by a friend. It is a cute little boutique french hotel. We opted to stay in a boutique hotel rather than a larger chain hotel to experience a little bit of culture. Relais is right near Notre Dame, and in walking distance to many sights. We walked everywhere, but if interested in taking the train or the metro, it is just a few blocks from the St. Michel train station which also takes you directly to Charles DeGualle airport. There is lots of action happening around this hotel with little creperies and bistros on every street. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They recommended several restaurants in walking distance which were excellent...allard for lunch, le christine for dinner (we had the pre-fix and it was a fabulous experience), and Jacques Cagna also for dinner. The rooms are small, but we expected this in Paris. Comparable to NY hotel rooms, ours was actually larger! We had plenty or room to maneuver around even with our suitcases. The elevator is tiny, but this is case throughout France....we didn't mind taking the stairs to walk off all the great food we were enjoying!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: larryandnancy005
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend 10 days at the Vieux Paris, and our experience could not have been better. I need only echo many of the good things said by other reviewers: the room was comfortable and charming ( we had a junior executive, so there was enough room, the bathroom was small though perfectly adequate with modern fixtures and plush terrycloth robes. The location, one block from the Place St. Michel, and 200 meters from the Seine, was ideal. Best of all was the staff. From the owners "on down", everyone was charming, gracious, helpful, and, despite their knowledge of English, tolerant, indeed encouraging, of our attempts at French. Rather than being merely a place to sleep while we were enjoying Paris, our stay at the Vieux Paris was one of the many enjoyable aspects of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “charming, with excellent concern”
Reviews.Author: DRT1404
Reviews.Content: The owner focused on great service, and was extremely helpful with suggestions and maps for our trip. We would definitely stay there again. Also a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an interesting history”
Reviews.Author: Sam_122UK
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel is in a great location on the left bank (5 mins max to St Michel metro, 2 mins more to Notre Dame), the staff are really helpful, there are loads of great places to eat on the doorstep and yet it is quiet (despite our room being on the street). The hotel also has an amazing history as it was known as the Beat Hotel, where the likes of Allen Ginsberg (fleeing America's obsenity trials) and William Burroughs stayed in the 60s. The lobby has a number of photos of the various writers and artists who stayed in this hotel in that period, and there are lots of books and a number of films about this place. I didn't realise all this when I booked it, so it was a real bonus. One tip though - as my booking did not include breakfast, and at 13 euros per person we clocked up quite a big bill after 3 nights, so if you can get dressed without coffee I would suggest you find a cafe in one of the adjacent side streets and have your breakfast elsewhere. Other than that I really couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: litterbug
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is spot on. It is just a short walk from St. Michel and the metro/train station. If you are an American and looking for something European then this is a great place to go. Staff was very friendly and made us feel at home. We were glad we skipped picking a classic hotel and stayed in such a great hotel and area.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On Location and Most Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: BritFrenchPol
Reviews.Content: To say I am picky about a hotel or B&B is an understatement. I like a place to be spotless, luxurious, close to where I want to go, have staff that is warm and welcoming and as knowledgeable as Google...and I want it at a reasonable cost. This hotel has it all. Europe is famous for tiny rooms, but our suite (2 rooms/en suite bath) was big enough to move around in and keep 4 large pieces of luggage open and easily accessible. The bed was (on the European Hard Hotel Bed scale of 1 being concrete and 5 being comfy) a 3.5. The water was pressure excellent. Because we speak some French, it made communicating with the staff easier, but everyone spoke English. Remy and Rafaela, day concierges, suggested tours, restaurants, and provided maps, museum tickets, and weather reports as we requested, and they talked with us to find out our tastes so that when we went to a restaurant or did a tour, we were always more than pleased! The internet in the business office helped to keep us in touch with home and was always available. We were close to everything we wanted to see, and when we wanted a tour, the tour company was 200 steps away. The hotel is on a quiet side street and our room in the back so it was very quiet. Our belongings were always treated with care. The one minor drawback is the tiny elevator (big enough for one thin person and a 29 inch piece of luggage), and ancient winding stone stairs, but that wasn't a problem for us. Just thought I'd mention it for anyone who might be very heavy. The breakfast coffee was the best we had on our travels, and they brought in whatever you asked for! When we return to Paris, this will be our hotel again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming”
Reviews.Author: thetomas
Reviews.Content: I looked and looked and looked for a quaint hotel for my husband and I to spend our first week in Paris. We don't prefer huge chain hotels, as amenities like gyms, pools, in-hotel restauants etc are not important to us (altho they do have a computer with internet which we used almost every day). the Hotel du Vieux was perfect! unbelievablly convenient location, yet on a very quiet side street. Excellent service, great breakfast and nice rooms. Many nice restaurants within mintues walking distance and steps from 2 (!) metro stations. Be sure to ask Ramie for restaurant recommendations, he has a knack for picking the perfect place... The top floor room had a loft and skylights!

Reviews.Title: “Great cozy hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Beacherfamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel du Vieux Paris with my three kids aged 9-13 this past Sept and we loved the hotel and the location was absolutley perfect. The hotel is charming and the staff were very polite and helpful. It is a block from the Seine River and the Saint Michel metro station and a short walk to Le Louvre and Notre Dame. The small back streets behind the hotel are alive with shops, markets and restaraunts.and great for the kids with a wide variety of food and souveniers. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located”
Reviews.Author: AussieDaydreamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August with my mum. Great little boutique place in an awesome neighbourhood and has the smallest lift I've ever been in! Great access to metro and just a short stroll along the Seine takes you to Notre Damn and the Lourve. The room was small but we didn't need anything bigger. The hosts were very welcoming and more than helpful. We had a lovely stay here and would recommend it in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2guppies
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we were only going to be there for a couple days, so we wanted a hotel that was conveniently located to see as much as possible in such a short period of time. This hotel was perfect in that regard. It's only a couple blocks from Notre Dame, less than a block from the Seine (lovely for a night stroll), and within easy walking distance of the Louvre. We even walked to the Eiffel Tower, although admittedly it's a bit of a distance. The size of the room was certainly smaller than American hotel rooms, but perfectly adequate and probably large by European standards. It was beautifully decorated and charming in every way, and had a mini bar and safe. We did not have breakfast at the hotel since there are so many cafes nearby to enjoy. What sets this hotel apart is the personalized attention paid by each and every staff member. Since we do not speak any French, that fact that everyone spoke fluent English was particularly helpful. I can't say enough about how well we were treated and cared for in those two short days. We can't wait to return to Paris and will definitely stay here again. The only suggestion would be to be sure to ask for a room on an upper floor or one that does not face the street. Although the hotel is located on a quiet little street, there is a large bar/restaurant at the end of the street and several cafes and bars nearby, so we did hear some noise each night around 2 a.m. Other than that, it was an absolutely perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: justhetwoofus
Reviews.Content: We recently celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary in Paris, an event that was made even more special by staying at the Relais-Hotel du Vieux Paris. This was our fourth visit to this charming boutique hotel on the left bank, situated just off the Quai and within easy walking distance to Notre Dame, the musee d'Orsay, Ile Saint Louis and many fine bistros. We continue to return because of the owner Madame Odillard and her marvelous staff. From the time we arrived until our departue the hotel made us feel welcome, wanted and like old friends. The hotel is Madame Odillard"s passion and it shows in her attention to details. French linen tablecloths are set out in the tiny but charming breakfast nook where each morning fresh croissants, baguettes and strong coffee are ready to awaken your senses. The guest rooms, eah decorated in their own individual fashion with exquisite fabric on the walls are a treat for the eyes. Although small, both areas are fully attentive to your every need. The staff goes out of their way to recommend and critique restaurants in the area, give directions, advice on the best way to get around the city and what not to miss. They share your adventures of the previous day and encourage discoveries of a new restaurant. You feel like a guest in a fine French home when you visit this hotel. We wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else in Paris and plan to return again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY + UNCOMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: faffina
Reviews.Content: even though I got an internet offer I found this hotel overpriced, dirty, uncomfortable, unwelcoming, unprofessional and definitely not 4 stars. I chose it because of the ratings among other hotels in this area. The room I was given at the top of the building was full of dust, hair in the shower, uncomfortable bed, noisy airconditioning vent outside the window and noisy toilet flush. The bathroom was very small, no place to stand and the mirror was too far to see much in it. The breakfast was just ok but the 2 waiters disappeared (to clean the rooms?) in the middle of it so I could not get some milk for my cereals. The wifi was not working. I dont have any positive comment about this hotel and I am very surprised about the good rates on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, charming place, no wireless”
Reviews.Author: profgjay
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel occupies a 500 year-old building some 50 yards from the Seine, on a quiet street surprisingly close to the buzz of Place St Michel. We had a fourth floor room, which was sizable by historic Paris standards but will still be found tight by some Americans. Beware the descriptions claiming wireless internet: it doesn't work, and you have to use the business office downstairs to get online (so if all you have is your Blackberry or iPhone, you are out of luck). Some of the best nouvelle restaurants are two blocks away (Ze Kitchen Galerie, Les Bouquinestes, L'Epigramme), and its a five minute stroll across the bridge to St Chappelle, Notre Dame, etc. and a quick Metro ride to the Louvre, Le Marais, or anywhere else. You can take the RER B train directly from the CDG airport to Place St Michel and walk one block to the hotel, saving tons of money. While the Continental Breakfast may be expensive, it's delicious, and you won't find much food before noon at bistros or brasseries. This is a great romantic getaway for couples, and a terrific neighborhood for young people in search of nightlife. Not recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city, Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyCouple09
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location Raffaella and her staff could not have been more helpful. All speak English, all were so friendly and kind. What a great place to stay!! A quiet little street that is a 2 minute walk to a great square with cafes, restaurants (even a Canadien & an Irish Pub) & shopping. The Siene, St Chapelle & Notre Dame are in view after about 30 steps. Don`t miss St Chapelle! On a recommendation from Raffaella we saw an orchestra perform Vivaldi`s "The Four Seasons" in St Chapelle. (I am not a classical music guy but it was awesome!) I can`t recommend Hotel du Vieux Paris highly enough. Our magical 8 days of perfect weather in a beautiful city started at this great little perfectly located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi48128
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel this is. The rooms are absolutely charming. The hotel, located on a quiet street is just a few steps away from the metro, as well as a wide array of restaurants and cafes. Located right between the Latin Quarter and St Germain, the area is lively and within walking distance of many of the main attraction. The staff is warm and welcoming. When we left, it was like saying goodbye to old friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Maje
Reviews.Content: (Maybe it is a little late to share this review now, 2,5 years after I stayed there, but I walked passed this hotel when I was in Paris again last weekend and it reminded me that I hadn`t written a review) Anyway.. my husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights right after we got married in 2006. It was an excellent mini-honeymoon and we had a great time! The hotel is very special with just a few rooms, all individually decorated. We stayed in the blue, flowery one with wooden pillars in the bathroom and bedroom. Very clean and unique hotel. And quiet - located in a very narrow street close to the Seine. The best thing of all, though, is the closeness to the sights and the RER (local train). You can go from CDG airport directly to St. Michel and walk to the hotel (easy walking distance, even with suitcases). Saves you the change in the metro. The hostess was very service-minded and polite, and we felt very well taken care of. One of the best hotels I`ve stayed in on my visits to Paris! So, if you can afford it, it really has everything you need. (Very small elevator, though, so it is not suited for disabled)

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in France”
Reviews.Author: Fireweed
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world and have nothing but great things to say about the Relais in Paris. The rooms are wonderful and the you could't ask for a better location. It is similar to the smaller boutique hotels in the States, with exceptional, friendly service, and rooms that are large enough to make you feel at home in Paris. It is almost right across the street from Notre Dame and just blocks away from the Louvre. There are wonderful restaurants in the area, yet the hotel is tucked away on a quiet street. I think it's an excellent value for the money and a place where you can get the personalized service of the staff. Remy is particularly helpful. If you don't stay here you'll be missig out on a great experience. Kathy from Alaska and Mickey from N.J.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Charming, and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KeenaNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Tucked away on a tiny, quiet steet this cozy hotel is just steps from the lively Boulevard St. Michel, the Ile de Cite, Notre Dame, and major metro and RER stations. The location, amenities, and friendly staff of the hotel helped us combine business with a romantic getaway. One of us had to work, during the day, but we both got to enjoy evenings in Paris for a week. Each room in this small hotel (just 19 rooms) is unique. Exposed beams and the occasional wall or pillar of creamy stone reveal the 15th century origins of the building. Our two-room suite with elegant fabric covered walls had all the modern comforts and conveniences, including a small "garden" of potted plants outside our window. (Attention history buffs. In an earlier day this was where the "Beat" writers like Ginsberg hung out in th fifties.) The suite arrangement worked well when one of us needed to work or read and the other wanted to rest. We had WiFi connections in the room and a small business center with a printer on the main floor. To get to work in the suburbs, my friend caught the RER just around the conrner and communted with the rest of the Parisians. Evenings he returned to the heart of the city where we were surrounded by a wide variety of cafes, restaurants, music and clubs. The neighborhood is alive 24/7. Withing easy strolling distance (about four blocks), we heard a chamber music concert at St. Julian de Pauvre, a jazz pianist to Le Petit Pont, and stopped by the famous English language Shakespeare's Used Books where writers like James Joyce used to work and read.. I can't say enough about the staff, especially its charming owners. Everyone is multi-lingual, and they were helpful with advice about everything from where to get your hair done to recommending and arranging reservations for both business dinners and our own romantic evenings. (Our French associates were particularly impressed with "our" restaurant choices. And you know the French, "first the food.") This lovely hotel will continue to be our home in th heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Vieux Paris - great location”
Reviews.Author: handelfan
Reviews.Content: Vieux Paris is a small but comfortable hotel on the left bank. When I travel, I enjoy visiting museums and historic sites, and I always try to attend local music performances. Notre Dame Cathedral is only 3 blocks away. The Louvre, Orsay, and Beaubourg are only a few metro stops away (and the St. Michel metro station is one block from the hotel). Three churches that have regular evening chamber music concerts are a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. It is possible to find cheaper accommodations outside of central Paris, but staying in the middle of the left bank is so convenient. On this trip, the hotel staff helped me choose restaurants for two informal dinners with business associates. Their choices were perfect -- I would take my friends to either restaurant. Service at the hotel was flawless: friendly and efficient. I will definitely come back, and I will bring my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RTL63
Reviews.Content: I am a 45 year old professional who recently went to Paris for the first time. I was in Paris for only one night, before heading to Provence, so I wanted a place that was well located. I am also a frequent business and pleasure traveler so have reasonably high expectations. This hotel is absolutely beautiful, charming and clean. The staff was accommodating and helpful and the location, for getting around, seeing the sites and experiencing the "cafe culture" of Paris, was absolutely perfect. The hotel sits on a quiet street, a half block off the Seine, across the river from and between Notre Dame and the Louvre. From the hotel I walked to those landmarks, up the Champs- Elysees, to the Eiffel Tower and everywhere in between ( I am pretty fit and the walks were long but more than pleasant). I walked to dinner, bars and cafes. It is also very well-located near the St Michelle station for the RER (about a block) if you do as I did and take that in from CDG for about 8.50 euros. I didn't get in a taxi until I had to get my luggage to Gare Lyon for the trip South. This is a wonderful hotel and I will stay there again next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: FEMNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel since my first trip to Paris in 1981 -- prior to its renovation/restoration. This is a lovely place with --always-- the warmest staff. Great location -- quite street in a lively central area. Walk to the corner for a beautiful view of Notre Dame. Sit in the litle park a few blocks away by ST. Julien le Pauvre. Mme Odillard -- and now her daughter-in-law -- run the place efficiently. It is spotless and charming (though a bit pricey) I have stayed at a few other places in Paris -- also nice --but the welcome here is like you would expect from an old friend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: bedfordbaps
Reviews.Content: This was a christmas present to me from my partner as I had never been to Paris. The flight was great and the transfer a little hairy as they drivers are mad! We got the metro back to the airport as we found this really easy after being in France for a few days. The Hotel was very welcoming although we found the tiny lift a but scary but soon became used to it. I think all the carpets were new as you could smell that as soon as you entered you room. We were on the top floor overlooking the rooftops in the big bathroom. The room itself was small and it had a mezzanine floor which we did not use.I would have liked tea/coffee making facilities but that said, you stepped out the door of the hotel and you were 2 minutes walk from the cafes and a starbucks if that is your thing. We had breakfast on the last morning, massive cups of coffee and fresh pressed juice.Very nice but it was good to have a walk first and then enjoy breakfast in french style in the cafes. This Hotel is in a superb location and some friends joined us on the Friday and also loved it. They are booking to go back as will we one day. It is not cheap but worth it for the location and as a specila treat.Very nice people in the Hotel and helpful and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experienc and Location”
Reviews.Author: bsquid
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great location on the Left Bank, superb rooms and extremely friendly staff, this is the place. We were in room #37, which we didn't request, but from what we understand is quite special, with its small seperate seating area, massive exposed beams and king bed. This was the first time staying in Paris we didn't mind just sitting in the room enjoying a bottle of wine. There are a few pubs, cafes and resturants on the same street that are so close, it is like they are in the "lobby". Highly recommend this place, dollar for dollar much more value then some of the other top end boutique hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant year after year!”
Reviews.Author: Stockmavn
Reviews.Content: Great location, pleasant staff, clean, comfortable, affordable, unostentatious rooms at a fair price. What more could you ask for in Paris? I stay here year after year, and never regret it. A true European style hotel. Marvelous!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: reynardMass.
Reviews.Content: There is no place I would rather stay in Paris then here. Year after year, they never disappoint. The rooms are comfortable, nicely furnished, well maintained, have every amenity, with a thoughtful selection in the minibar, the toiletries, etc. I loved the nice deep tub in my bathroom. Breakfasts are great -they are one of the first things I eagerly look forward to from the first day-especially the cafe-au-laits, brioches, croissants, baguettes, etc. The staff are very attentive and ready with a warm welcome. It really has become a home away from home to come back to every year.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: rkodwyer
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to this hotel after the apartment we had booked was flooded. Despite its four star rating, the hotel was very disappointing. Our room was tiny - barely large enough to fit a standard double bed - no more than 150 sq feet. With two of us in the room all you could do was sit on the bed. The television was tiny. The bathroom was also disappointing. The shower over the bath had a shower curtain in very poor condition, rather than the glass screen I'd expect of a four star hotel. The hairdryer, which is a key advertising point of the room on the company's website, was an absolute joke. It was impossible to dry your hair with. Service was adequate, although they would not bring an iron and ironing board to our room - we had to go downstairs to reception to press clothes. The only thing going for this hotel is its location, which is excellent. However for the money, the apartment we transferred back to after one night at Vieux Paris was infinitely better value and far, far more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Loverofluxury
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in an excellent location. We requested a quiet room and that's just what we got. Peace and quiet in the heart of St Michael. Our room was charming with exposed beams even in the bathroom. We didn't bother with breakfast as there are so many places nearby. This hotel is on the same street as the Villa D'estrees which we considered,but it is right next door to a lively bar as reviews have described. The lift is not for claustraphobics!! We have been to Paris on many occasions and would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: VandenAvond
Reviews.Content: This hotel can't be beat. My husband and I stayed here the first week in October and we will never stay anywhere else. The location is amazing. The personalized service superb. Daniel was exremely helpful. We had a suite on the 5th floor and it was very large and beautiful. We had a loft in our room and we actually used it a lot. We would have our breakfast there every morning. The breakfast was great. Wonderful crescents, bread and cheeses. Freshly squeezed orange juice and coffe, tea or hot chocolate. The bathroom had a nice jacuzzi. The neighborhhod was great. Great restaurants and shopping. Just steps away from major attractions. We can't wait for our next stay. We will never stay anywhere else. If you need any additional information, feel free to email me at vandenavond1@comcast.net. Cary & Angie

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1Wanderer2Another
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. Easily within walking distance of anything you'd like to do on the left bank. It's also very close to the metro and several ATMs. We switched rooms three times. The first room (deluxe) was very nice, but was on the first floor street level, and we found it far too noisy. The first floor suite was also very nice, but there was a leak from the room above making the carpet wet and the room smell moldy. There was also mold in the bathroom around the jacuzzi tub. The third room (regular), on the second floor, was perfect. Although it was exceptionally small, it was quiet and had a very comfortable bed. The concierge service was not what I expected from the reviews I read and the great communication we had prior to our trip. The highlight was the wonderful driver the hotel had waiting for us at the airport, and the conversations with him to keep him there when we were delayed by our luggage. I was dismayed that the champagne, chocolates, and flowers that I ordered were not in our room when we arrived. Also, maybe it was our poor French, but they could not help us book a trip to Reims. The information the hotel gave my husband was not helpful, they did not book the trip, and the tourism office the conceirge sent my husband to did not book trips to Reims. Also, they may not be able to get you a taxi from one point in Paris to another - getting a taxi to the airport is apparently easier. Also concerning the rooms, I was dismayed that when I requested two additional pillows (they give you 3 for a queen bed) only one was available.

HotelInfo.Name: Relais Hotel du Vieux Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 9 Rue Git le Coeur, 75006 Paris, France
